review: Not the best place to go to especially if you have a large group. I came here multiple times and each were unpleasant. Wait time can be as long as an hour especially if it's dinner time. After a horrific long wait you still have to wait forever for a Staff to come take your order and bring you the food. Normally I'm a fast eater and prefer things to be quick especially dinner time. By quick I mean in and be done with dinner within an hour or a bit more. When I come here,I lose about 3 hours of my life waiting for service and food itself which actually  gives you a lot of time to think of something to talk about and catch up with friends. Not saying catching up is bad but I prefer to do that somewhere else afterwards like a dessert place, a cafe, bar or something. Servers took a while to flag down so that frustrated most of the people in my group. For it's price , it's pretty expensive for the quality of the  service and flavor of the food .

Since my last review there have been a few improvements as far as food is concerned. I am so glad to have this spot back to a better status. The Jack Daniels menu is always a perfect go-to if feeling indecisive.  The bartenders can get pretty busy and could take a few mins to get to you, but the drinks are  yummy, if you don't mind waiting 10 mins. On popular nights it can be a wait of up to an hour, particularly weekends. But i hate to wait especially when I'm hungry so I prefer weekdays for this place. The patio is open for dining so I look forward to the warmer months sitting outside looking at the boats in the bay. The staff is still inattentive and blah. The bathrooms always look like a hurricane hit. I find myself wondering if the staff was held at gunpoint to apply for work here, that is the only explanation my husband and I could come up with to explain why they all look so miserable. Ugh but if you're okay with the wait and the neglect, the food is great! Might have to ask a few times for forks and napkins, but at least you'll have food.

We came here very rude and nasty workers we where seated an had to wait 20   minutes till we got drinks cause I had to complain to manager about service then tell me apps we can't share can't tell people what to do with our food,worst place to go

I LOVE ME SOME FRIDAYS!!!! But I don't know who they hired since the re opening but they need to try again. SERVICE SUCKED!!! My waitress got everything wrong. It took her about 15 minutes to put the orders in, then when she did it, she neglected to mention that their menu had changed and they no longer serve things they way we may remember it. I never got my pineapple juice that I ordered and instead got a drink that I didn't order. She was slow returning to the tables when she said she would be back. We had to request straws, and utensils because they weren't there, AND we placed out whole order before she realized that we didn't have menus. It was horrible. STAY AWAY!!!!

So me and my boy went there for Thursday night football his idea! Place is nice inside the food really sucks... Had the spicy chicken tenders which was drenched in that nasty spicy buffalo sauce!!! Then had the burger which was full of oil and butter that was so nasty I couldn't finish it was the worst burger I have ever had...on top of it all I got food poisoning!!!! This sucks!! Will never go to any Fridays again!!!!

Some days I am satisfied about the service and some I'm not. But most of the time the service sucks here and they take forever to come to your table ... It's a nice location and nice out door seating and very clean but service sucks !!!
Service was very slow. I had to wait about a half hour longer then everyone else and they left the avacado out of my salad. Food was ok. Service was not ok.

My boyfriend and I went to the restaurant the first week they reopened since Hurricane Sandy.  Service was horrible. We heard a lot of people complaining about their service but we gave our server the benefit of the doubt even though she had a few customers complaining about her service as well. Long story short, she was the worst waitress I ever had at any restaurant. She was slow and didn't want to work. The waitress complained that no one was helping her with only 4 tables. Realyy?!! 4 tables and two were vacant. We complained to management and was told that they hired a lot of new staff. The food took forever to come out that we were thinking about leaving. Also, the food was cold.  Tip for management: hire experienced workers or ensure your staff are trained!!!! Will go back after the waiters get a few months experience

From the appetizer to dinner everything went wrong. The Manager wasn't helpful, He didn't seem to care if I was unhappy and didn't give me any other option as far as seeing if I wanted anything else. I will NEVER come here again. It's a Friday night at that.

Terrible service! Filthy bathrooms! Sat at the bar, ordered breadsticks & wings (both appetizers). The breadsticks took 40 minutes to come out. The wings never arrived. To make matters worse, a couple that sat down 30 minutes after us, got their apps before us. Shame that this place closed after Hurricane Sandy and reopened (with the assistance of loads of tax payer dollars no doubt) with a better look, but awful service! Won't be back.

Friday's was the spot to go before the movies. I've been going to this place since I was 18 years old. I had a total of like 6 birthdays here. Amazing spot, the appetizers are always perfect and the entrees are always cooked exactly to the right amount. Service is remarkable and professional!

The worst dinner experience I ever had. The service sucks !! I don't know who the hell is running this place .We waited over 45 min for our appetizer and then on top of that they forgot one of the appetizers. At first we tried to be understanding,our waitress kept saying it's not her fault it's the cooks. But this was ridiculous. Our entrees took Almost two hours to come and then we were about to walk out n she brought them out mines still wasn't ready even after two hrs of wait all my friends n boyfriend food was cold dry n nasty. It was the worst we ask to speak to the manager we kept waiting no body ever came n then I even waited for them to give me my card back... unbelieveable!! We ended up playin for the appetizers and on top of that the next day we all ended up sick from the food. Never again ! This place can rot  Please I much have rather went across the street and ate movie theatre food or Mayb heat up a TV dinner at home.

Befor the storm in Sheepshead Bay-- I was their every week and LOVED it, but since it reopened it SUCKS!! I will never go back! This is a sin since I have a $50 gift certificate.. The staff and manager needs to be retrained took 15 mins to write our order-really? the 4 of us had 2-2 for's!!  Everyone seems so lost,out in left field with a catchers mitt-no smiles or greetings...After waiting way over 2 hours on a Thursday afternoon without even a drink of water, and several complaints-we decided enough was enough and for the 1st time in my life we walked out, I did finally see the manager which didn't help!!

I worked at TGI Fridays in the 80's - 90's in Florida.  Training was intense back then.  Apparently, now there is no training. 355 Brittany was our waitress. 45 minutes after we sat down, we were able to put in our drink order.  Told us she was sorry, but she had to put in a bunch of orders.  She had one other table.  I asked for a Michelob Ultra.  She said what?  I said Michelob Ultra.  She asked me to spell that.  So, I asked if they had it.  She said; if it's on the menu we have it.  25 minutes later, guess what?  They don't have it.  So, got a But Lt.  Keeping track of times now because of the original 45 minute wait. About another 45 minutes go by, and she says sorry, again, would you like to order.  So we ordered the Spinach Dip, and Pretzels with some kind of a dip.  While waiting for our Apps, some worker streaked by, dropped chips and salsa, and ran off like he was being chased by the cops.  355 Brittany saw that, and asked us why he dropped that off there?  I said; damn good question.  So, she took it away, and who knows where that went. Apps, finally come, but with no dipping sauce for the pretzels.  So, we asked for some, and she said; oh would you like to order some.  We said, no it's supposed to come with it, look at the menu.  So, she said; oh, okay.  I'll order you some.  (IF YOU'VE FORGOTTEN ABOUT OUR DRINKS, IT'S ONLY YOU AND 355 BRITTANY.)  So, after about 15 minutes of waiting for the sauce, we asked AGAIN for the sauce, and our drinks.  She said; oh, your drinks are at the bar.  She brought those, but still no sauce.  Finally, we asked for the check and told her to forget the sauce. I blame TFI Fridays for this, cause when I worked there, 355 Brittany would not be able to run her own tables unless she was FULLY trained.   WILL NEVER GO BACK TO THIS ONE IN MY LIFE!!!!
Food "ok". Good atmosphere. It took for ever to serve, and to bring the food out. Asked for a check it took 15min.  Then they apologized said they are testing their new tablet system.

Probably the worst TGIF anywhere.  I struggled to find anything to like, and I tried because there's a great view of the bay and the place has potential.  However, servers are untrained and service is dismal. Food is sketchy and I'm concerned about cleanliness. Restaurant is dirty and it's only 5pm. What's up with all the fruit flies in this place? They're buzzing around my food and drinks. I don't plan to repeat the experience here anytime soon.

Recently reopened, I ventured out on a Saturday night to eat before seeing a movie with friends. The service was slow, the servers themselves seemed to have no idea what they were doing or what was even on the menu and my beer order was screwed up twice. The food, however was still on par. Thinking this was a just due to a busy Saturday night, I simply let it pass.  However, as I type this, I am back today with my family. And there is no mistake, these servers have no idea how to be professional. They were all standing around watching a basketball game, it took 20 minutes just to get two beers and a seltzer. We asked the waitress for a ginger ale, only to find out 30 minutes later there is no ginger ale. We asked if they had juice, orange to be specific. The waitress tried to offer us a lemonade or Cherry coke. We just wanted orange juice. Simple. Another waitress finally got us our OJ.  Now the food, the wings are still good and there is no way to screw up a salad. But the burgers were doused in salt and undercooked. And the chicken was charred and as hard as a Hockey Puck. The waitress  just admitted that the cooks are "still learning in the kitchen." How can you get a job as a cook if you don't know how cook!? Atleast they didn't screw up my beer order.  Until the managers lock down a decent wait staff and kitchen, I will not be returning to this location.

Went to TGI for the first time and it was close to the theaters. So heck why not. Rating as follows. Staff 3 of 5 -  avg Food 2 of 5  - bad Wait time 3 of 5 - avg. Decor 4 of 5 - good view of water. Overall 2.5 of 5.  Pros : Decor Cons: Food. Conclusion: Your Call.

Food is good but the wait staff needs better training. Only a few times I came and actually got good service. I suggest sitting at the bar. The waitress, Hephsiba is horrible I had her two times and she still can't get it right. I waited forever for everything and she swiped my card then took two tables orders before giving me my papers to sign and I know she saw I was pissed off my then.

Here on a Saturday afternoon, beat the mad rush, still had to wait about 10-15 for a table. Jonathan our waiter was very pleasant and accommodating, maybe some of the staff here got the message that you get more tips with honey. Food was regular TGIF standards, ewe Aleuts go for the JD ribs

I do not recommend this place. The food is awful, often cold and greasy, and lacks flavor. The drinks are decent, but the food was so bad that my boyfriend and I couldn't even finish our appetizers, despite being very hungry when we got there. The sad part is that the wait staff is amazing, the waiters and waitresses are so kind and attentive, but nothing makes up for the food. :/

The food tasted good. But the utensils were dirty, it still had food on it. And it was wrapped in a napkin. The waitress brought another one, the same thing. The third one didn't. Opted to use my hands since it was ribs and fries.  But now it's making me wonder if the plates get washed, or the pots the same lousy way.

Where to begin...place was full but not overly packed so I have no explanation for my experience last night.  Drinks took about 30 mins to come after we ordered them and we were sitting at the tables at the bar.  The food took even longer which was crazy bc we ordered standard apps.  I guess they ran out of potatoe skins bc they never showed up but instead we rec'd double mozz sticks, would have been nice for our waitress to let us know.  Moved to the bar and bartender asked "are you going to order w us?"  I guess he thought we were deadbeats and were just going to sit and the bar and not order any more drinks.  The best part, was when we were ready to order another round and he was nowhere to be found.  Shame on me for going back after I swore I wouldn't bc our last visit resulted in my husband being served a burger with several long hairs cooked into it.  Not kidding!!!!  The managers of this Friday's and especially corporate should be embarrassed.  Never again!

Stopped by after seeing a movie . Food was actually decent for a chain restaurant .Average  tasting wings and a chicken cob salad that was  actually very fresh .   The service was unorganized and its border line ghetto on the customers.  Servers were friendly and we actually saw a wedding party show up which made it worth it . LOL

This is the worst fridays I have ever been to. The service was so slow, the kitchen was even slower and there was maybe 7 tables at the restaurant at the time. Don't waste your time here. The servers have no sense of urgency, they are more worried about socializing

I would give zero stars if it was available.....where to i begin.....first our waitress anna couldnt be bothered with properly helping her customers on a very slow night for bussiness we waited an hour and a half for our meals which by the way all five orders were either wrong or missing something and then we asked for cocktail sauce for shrimp the waitress decided my fiance and my sister in law needed to bathe in it and spilled it on them(she reached over a railing and over their heads to try and put it on the table) and we ordered endless apps which came to an end because we never got our refill on our wings...we then asked for the manager so we can explain this debacle and she gave us a "50%" discount i guess $48 is half of $150 .....absolute iddiots in this place and i will never ever go back

We got our table around 5. Half an hour to get our drinks.(coke). Over an hour for the food. My sister got the endless appetizer. First buffalo wings, and she ordered crispy bean fries, but 45 mins later we told them forget it. We need to leave. The only reason this place is getting 3 stars is bc the manager was so apologetic and took off the $10 appetizer off our bill. But overall, it was a frustrating dinner. We even missed our movie time and had to cancel going to the movies across the street.

We went on a Wednesday night and it took them forever to seat us. It was no where near crowded. Waitress took a long time to come to us and our drinks came 20 minutes after our appetizer.  The boneless buffalo wings were terrible, more batter than chicken.  The ribeye steak was terrible as was my sizzling chicken (over cooked).  Terrible food, terrible service, never again

Used to come here all the time after a movie across the street at UA. The staff back then were all friendly and attentive from what I remember regardless of how busy it got. Nowadays, some staffs are rude and forgetful or they mess up your order.  As a franchise, the food is good. The typical menu items are hard to get wrong for the most part... But recently we've been getting at least one thing wrong. Either a mixup on orders or wrong sides or wait too long before we can get a drink refill. It really depends on who is waiting on you. To me this place has become a hit and miss.

Ordered three items from the Fridays app to pick up in store. Ordered at 5:40 p.m., confirmation said it would be ready by 6 p.m. Went to Friday's, waited until 6:40 for the food - they didn't even know what we ordered.  After waiting for 40 minutes, the potato skins we got were just oil and grease along with about two drops of onion sour cream in the takeout container. Never again.  I wonder if I'll get the same cut and paste reply from the restaurant now about them passing my feedback along to the team...it really is a shame, this place was great years ago.

This place has been nicely renovated post Sandy. The bar area looks really modern with an open concept.  The servers were kind but seemed a bit overwhelmed.  The food was typical fridays food. Overall my family and I enjoyed ourselves.

It was extremely crowded in here tonight which is understandable.......it's the start of the weekend. My plan was to sit down and eat dinner with my sons before catching a movie at 8:30 pm but that didn't happen because of the long wait time. I decided that we would order takeout instead so that we wouldn't have to rush through our food. The wait for takeout food was as long as the wait to be seated. Finally our food comes and we were out the door and off to the car to eat our food before the movie. The reason why I gave them only three stars is because of the long wait and there were no plastic cutlery or napkins to accompany our food. Fifty dollar bill and no napkins and utensils........like seriously! To top it off, my order consisted of a sampler which included pretzel sticks, mozzarella sticks and boneless Buffalo wings was missing a pretzel stick which I'm not happy about!

service is awful. didn't know spup was served as a dessert. got the soup at the end of the meal. endless apps is a scam. waited at least a half hour between each refill. save your time and money. would not wish this experience on my worst enemy. the last time i was here had the same experience. waited till everyone was finished with their food to get my chicken quesadilla. The best part was I was told it took so long because they cut the pico de gallo fresh. To my surprise I did not know it took over an hour to chop tomatoes and onions. Its a special kind of stupid working in this place. Gave it a second chance and they failed miserably.

This is the worst place Ive ever been to. The service is ridiculous. They have the laziest staff Ive ever encountered. I asked for a beer and it took 15mins before they came back to tell they dont have it. We got 3 things it took 3o mins. Just apps. And we watched as each one of the workers had an attitude that they had to serve us. I always hated this place but decided to give them another shot. Was the worst thing Ive done. I use to come here before and it was good but since the upgrade it just plain old SUCKSSSS. Dont even come here. Applebees is way better and not that far away. STAY AWAYYY. Still dont know why Yelp doesnt give zero stars. One star is a good thing for this shitty place.

Absolutely disgusting. First off, the floor was very slippery to walk on. Second, the place where we were seated was very dirty. The chairs had leftover food on the seat and the armrest was oily, the menus had sauce and drink stains. There were also french fries practically scattered all around the floor. The waitress didn't look like she even want to work or deal with this place anymore. She swept up the fries but didn't even wipe or wash or mop up the oil or residue left behind. She had to show my fiancé something on the menu and decided to reach across the table and almost elbowing my face 6x. To end it with a bang, the water came with a leaf or some sort of green plant in it. I don't even want to go on about the food or the long wait for the check. Never again. This is NOT for first time here but will be my last.

We came on a Tuesday a bit after noon to celebrate our little guys moving up to kindergarten.  So it was just the 3 of us and the restaurant seemed pretty empty.  We sat down, placed our order, and then waited,  and waited and waited and the place started to fill up.  The people behind us were getting more attention than we were and directly next to us a family of 6 sat and ordered well after we did.  They started to get their appetizers and still no one appeared to notice us.  We are noticing that all around us people were getting their food.  We agreed that if the family of 6 got their food before us we would leave.  Sure enough they started to bring their entrees and we had ordered way before this family even showed up.  We were preparing to leave and just as I was getting up to walk out .... our food came.  Food was ok.  Potato skins were burnt ... the rest was what you would expect.  Not my first time having an issue with this Fridays at this location.  Last time we were left at our table and no one ever came to take our order.  Even after we complained.  We eventually walked out after 45 minutes of being completely ignored.
Pricey but good atmosphere. Awesome view in the summer. Food is usually reliable as far as taste and portions. Good after work spot.

Food is tasty, but way over priced. No way should the chicken and shrimp pasta only come with 3 shrimps and 2 pieces of chicken when you want to charge over $20 for it. And the service is awful. Why on a snow day when there is 20 people in here it takes 15 minutes to get drinks and another 20 just to pay the bill. Very disappointing. Strawberry henny drink was delicious, but not good enough to come back for more. #sorrynotsorry #supportlocalbusiness #downwithfranchises

Horrible service, food was disgusting, everything tastes dry and old. After today's visit, I will never go to Fridays again. Very disappointed. Especially this particular spot.  Ps. Don't get the unlimited appetizer, they will serve you once and you will never see your server again. And if u tell someone else, they will say, "uh, u have to Order with your server" ....yeah? And where the hell is my server. No where in sight!!  Im feeling sick and like throwing up right now.

The service here was very fucking horrible came at 7 waited 20 minutes to be seated then we waited a whole hour for our drinks we ordered everything at one time and got the appetizer hrs later then when the food finally arrived we refused it and left everything was just horrible

this has to be one of the worst all round chain restaurant !! it all started in the valet parking area, when I arrived, the "kid" didn't think I wanted to park since, I was 12" past his area, as he sat in a customer's car, while it was lightly raining as I repositioned the car somewhat closer, he gave me the ticket. we then waited 30 mins for a table, they must a weird seating concept, in that there literally dozens of open tables, and dozens of people waiting DON'T get seated in the back in one of those 2 people tables, they are for people who weight 100 Lbs, maximum or children, much to cramped for any normal size adult.  After sitting for 15 minutes, while the assigned waitress walked around, I finally asked someone to summon a waitress to our table. She surprisingly says.. "I didn't see you there". We place out order and 15 minutes later it arrives, much to my surprise. While we're eating there are small kids 7-9 yr olds, running up and down the aisle. playing tag. Their parents, the waitress and other staff are oblivious. it's NOT a place to go for a normal meal, the staff are aloof, unattentive these people are not customer oriented by any means

Let me start of by saying I use to come here all the time, sometimes even twice a week before hurricane sandy happen when they had to close due to the hurricane I was so sad, now that it reopened I must say it has gone down hill the service use to be great the previous employees cared about the customers and were very professional after they reopened it has been long waiting time even when they sit u down all the employee are new and are terrible one employee actually refused being our server in front of my face it has gotten really bad hope the owner takes charge because it's going down hill !!!! Need professional who actually care about the customers ! Might just have to just stop coming here !!!

Wednesday 7:30pm. I go in, I see not 1 not 2 not 3 but at least 6-7 empty tables. And it's a 20-30 min wait. I don't understand why. Did i mention i only needed a table for TWO. The hostess was like usually Wed they keep the place mellow..  What does that even mean???  I think she meant to say "empty", keep the place empty.   I go into any restaurant in Manhattan or else where its packed with people and the wait is 20-30 mins.  Either they are under staffed or there's no management going on. You can bet I won't even think off coming back. Did I mention there was only 3 cars in their valet parking.???? So confused.!  Went to Applebee's

The Decore was beautiful. That place is so slow ...the hostess didn't seat anyone they were All confused ...the food came out on different time and the the kids meal took over an hour....are you serious?! The worse place ever! First and last time ...Never again
I love this place great ambiance,  great price for the a $6.00 Apple Crown holiday drink . Great service

Horrible service !!! Walked in there was nobody at the front booth to great us, then when somebody finally came and sat us that was another 10 minute wait. We Waited there for 15 minutes to have somebody take our order and not even the drinks came after 30 minutes of waiting again we left.

I always sit at the bar because I seen the bartenders dip their straw into someone's drink then served it to them with no hassle it was gross never thought I'd be seeing that especially out in the open where everyone can see you ??? Lol

Since this place has reopened, it has been a nightmare.  Let me my incident Father's Day: I called to place an order, someone took order, informed me that my order would be ready in 25 minutes and then placed me on hold. I arrived at Fridays 30 after the order and still on hold, I kept the line open. I was told that my order was never put it. It was written but never entered. I asked to speak to the manager, the funny thing is that one manager finally gets on the phone to assist me another is there standing with me in the restaurant.  I informed the manger that I was in the location already after being on hold for over 30 minutes. They felt embarrassed. To make a long, bad experience short...they said they wouldn't rush my order....I stayed there another 40 minutes.  One manger told me because it was Fathers's Day and it was busy that why this happened.  If I came on a Monday, my experience would have been great.  It's always been my understanding that weekends are normally busy at these establishments, it's a restaurant that's when most people go out to eat. AVOID THIS PLACE IF YOU CAN. VERY DISAPPOINTED.  It looks nice but the service sucks.
Okay, done with this place. We left and never coming back. Manager tried to offer free gift cards to come back but we refused and let her know there is no need. Way to go Friday's.

This is a convenient location to eat if your catching a movie at the theatre next door. The menu has a nice variety,  as always,  and the food is pretty predictable. Average to good but not great, sometimes mediocre. The problem here is the service, it just sucks!!! After waiting almost an hour to be seated, the waiter was asleep at the wheel. We had to ask for things repeatedly and then had to get a manager  to expedite the check to make the movie on time. Stop in only if you have more than two hours to kill.

Food was good our waiter was rushing us to order when we just the menu&when we was ready to order it took a long time to get get to come back she was to busy talking and joking with other staff and made us late for our movie I took two stars off because of this

The first time I came here my friend and I sat at the bar assuming we would get out food much faster but we were wrong. We waited almost an hour to get out food. I got my food first then my friend got hers almost 15 minutes later.  I came here again a couple of days ago on a Saturday I would say around 2/3 pm. It was packed at all and my boyfriend and I sat outside in the back. It was such a beautiful view. I actually reminded the waitress about my last visit and she said it wouldn't happen and she was right. Although I had to ask for water and wait maybe 10 minutes for the bill to come we did receive our food in a timely fashion. I did not like my shrimp and totally forgot I didn't like t last time either but overall it was ok. I gave a couple of extra stars since the service was a little better this time. I'll probably come back it's so huge inside...very spacious. And the outdoor is beautiful. There is also valet parking.

Well what can i say.  Service is everything. N this place is a hot mess. BUT IF YOU SIT AT THE BAR YOUR GOOD!!!  They changed there look dramatically.  No more outdoors. Big wall windows instead.  But again they need better service.  If you order certain appetizers is UNLIMITED BTW. but it has to be one type.  This place will get better i hope!!

This is the first time I'm here since they have reopened after sandy. I am very disappointed in almost everything. Starting off with the waiter, although he was very nice and tried to accommodate us, he seemed a little bit confused at times.  Perhaps it was his first few days working, but whatever the case is... it is unexusable to forget to order our drinks from the bar when we ordered them as soon as we got our first drink. He also failed to inform us that they were currently out of shrimp,  which was in our main course. We ordered the jack daniels sampler where the chicken and ribs were both very dry. It took for over an hour for our main courses to come out with a 10 min gap for one persons food. I will most likely will not be coming back.

I like the new and improved TGIF Friday's in sheepshead bay Brooklyn. The atmosphere is pleasant , families with their kids. I had the Jack Daniels chicken and shrimp . It was great the chicken didn't taste like rubber , it was fresh. My fiancé and myself had the plate so clean that the dishwasher guy wouldn't have a problem washing our plate. Great experience will definitely recommend to family and friends.

Since its reopened it really is different. Staff is friendlier food is better. Friday's deals are always great. I go there now like once a month instead of once every six months. Keep up the good work.

Love this Friday's.  The staff is pleasant and friendly, always a plus.  Drinks are pretty good too, not watered down, at least for my taste. I don't think I've ever had a bad meal here either.  Potatoe skins are always good as well as the steak entrées.  I usually order mine with fried shrimp on the side. Overall, love the vibe and that its across from UA theater.
Waited for 30 minutes for my waiter served everyone else but us the place isint even crowed  it's not even half busy . Server is rude however the foods good

Ohhhh honey...  Used to come often before Sandy. I Was stoked when it reopened. New decor,  check.  Great service... Ehhhh no check.  Slow, inattentive severs with a penchant for forgetfulness make this a miss.  If long waits for libations and food make you antsy or annoyed, slide past this staple for chain restaurants.

I came here at 3:40pm they informed us that the wait would be 20 minutes. That was the only part that was truthful. We were seated with no utensils or plates. We ordered the appetizers and were dissapointed to find that not only are they now serving half potato skins but they were so over cooked that they could not be eaten. [still no utensils at this point] they proceeded to give us plastic forks and knives.  It took almost an hour for the kids to get their food and here I sit still waiting for a simple burger. I've asked for the manager twice now and it's been almost half an hour, I'm still waiting. If I could I would give this place no stars but alas yelp does not allow this. It's disgusting how much they do not care about their patrons, I'm so dissapointed in this place that I grew up going to. I should have went to Applebee's.

The service was a mess. I went with 2 of my girlfriends and the waitress got both of their orders wrong and there was a hair on one of their plates. The waitress was nice and patient but she kept messing up. We ordered alcohol beverage and it tasted like juice. We probably won't be going back to that location. On a good note, I'm glad to see that they've fixed up the place since hurricane Sandy.

Took forever to be seated. Waitress had too many patrons. Used Fridays rewards coupon for chicken dish and it only took off $5 for BEEF sliders. The only good thing about this place is that it's next door to movie theatre.

Came in here tonight with a few friends to get some endless appetizers. Wings(boneless) good. Though some wings were just over glazed I can't complain they were good. The potato skins gross! They're so dry that they tasted stale bandaids . Extremely salty, and the cheese was like spray-can cheese-wiz that doesn't look appetizing even taste appetizing. The food was not in fact the issue. The issue is their horrible service. Extremely slow, most likely to forget what you ordered. Wait time for food would be forever. To back that up I saw a group of dudes get pissy because they sat down for over an hour and didn't get asked to be served. Even when a waiter/waitress would walk by and not care. Our waitress was really nice yet slow and there was barely any business. I've been here a times in the recent months 2/3 times bad experiences but this was the worst.

The worst sevice ever its a really nice setup but the manager should never be allowed to work here tables were dirty and the service was terrible we waited for drinks and food was the worst please dont waste ur time and money the whole staff needs to be replaced

Came here to grab a chicken Ceasar salad and chicken fingers first it took about 15 mins until someone came to sit us even though it was empty. Waited 10 more til I asked for a waiter. I ordered and to my amazement it took 38 mins to come. No reason to wait 38 mins for food specially when it's empty.

I go to this fridays from time to time.  as always the staff was awesome. Me and my friend got the Jack Daniel's steak and shrimp. It was okay. I will have to say this place is best for the appetizers. Endless appetizers always from now on.

Lmao. How are you going to answer the phone just saying hi in the most unhappiest way possible. Rude. I think you guys need a new hostess or whatever she is. Based on reviews it seems like your whole staff is ratchet  if you don't like your job then get another one. Don't ruin it for everyone. *end rant*

Worst restaurant I've been to in years! Wait staff is rude & disrespectful! Came here to celebrate my daughters birthday after the movies - figured it would be easy walking across the street gave them a day notice that I was bringing a big party - nothing was done to accommodate us - waitress was annoyed by our presence! Didn't want to take the order from the kids wanted me to give it to her - food took forever - no plates given for apps had to get up & get them myself from the station - no one bussed the table leaving us with a mountain of dirty dishes on the table while our meal was being served - took 20 minutes to get a drink - never checked on by our waitress & when I tried to get her attention she waved me off as if I wasn't important enough! Thank u for ruining what should have been a fun lunch for my daughters birthday. Manager did what she could to ease the tension of the situation but damage was already done!! I will never step foot in that place again! Avoid this place if you want to enjoy your meal!
Hate this place. Sat at the bar for 10 minutes before I was given a menu then sat there for another 10 minutes and no one checked on me asked if I was ready to  order. It wasn't even busy.

Worst service ever they should just stayed closed the waitress took forever to bring drinks and food and when the drinks came it was watered down im never going back until the learn hospitality in this establishment !!!

Absolutely disgusted with the lack of service when I was there for a early birthday lunch / dinner treat today. There was a ridiculously long wait time for the food to be brought to the table as well as it being cold when it was finally brought out .

The food is ok, the service sucks! My BF & I came in at around 1030 on a Monday night, the place was pretty dead. The host wasn't at the door so we had to wait until somebody finally came over to us. We are seated, and I order the ribs, shrimp & 2 sides. I asked for sweet potato FFs and the waitress says that's an additional $1.00, no problem. A different waiter comes over to bring us our food, he says "we are out of sweet potato FF, would you like regular FFs instead?" Again no problem, BUT .. Why wait until you bring me the food to tell me? Now I'm almost finished with my food when my original waitress comes to me to finally ask if everything is ok, I let her know that I never received my FFs. She apologizes and says she's going to bring them to me, I tell her to put them to go because I already finished my food. She comes back like 20 minutes later, with my bill. Still no FFs! At this point I don't even care I just want to leave so I check the bill and I'm still being charged an extra dollar for sweet potato FFs when I never even received a damn Ff! Now I'm just annoyed, I wait for her to come around and she takes forever, the manager comes over to my table because she can see that I'm waiting to pay, I let her know what happened and she tells me she's going to take care of it. Another 10 minutes pass, my waitress finally comes to my table with a dollar discounted off of my bill, she doesn't apologize or anything. Thank God I had a coupon (buy one entree, get one free) i hand it to her with my card and she leaves, another 10 minutes pass by, I see her walking around with my card like a lost puppy. She comes back to my table and I see I got about $20 dollars off of my bill (the best part of the horrid experience!) The coupon I used was a 3 in 1 coupon, meaning you could use it up to 3 times. You think she handed it back to me? Of course not. So at this point I don't even care, I gave her a lousy tip for the lousy service and I leave WITHOUT my coupon. That's fine, it's not like I plan on visiting again anyway!

My server faith was excellent n attentive , great additude n service, wait time 15 min tobe seated less than 30  got our food , had mottzarella appetizer n flat bread appettizer both excellent for main entree had burger n fries n the shrimp n fries both delicious would return.

Decided to take the wife out for after work drinks and dinner.  Got there around 8, it was a little bit of a wait.  Not a problem.   We are seated and the table isn't cleaned off.  The hostess goes to grab a rag and clean the table off for us to sit.  Ok, still no big deal.  We order our drinks and food.  The wait time for the drinks was a little long, but still, I can deal.  Our food came 30 minutes after.   My wife's food was cold and my food was missing my side dish.  The food was just placed on the table by a runner, no questions answered.  I track the waitress down (who is visibly flustered) and asked her about my side dish.  Her response: "what... They didn't bring it?"  IS IT ON THE TABLE?!?  NO THEY DIDNT BRING IT!   I get my side dish 5 min later, food is good.  Not gonna lie, despite my wife's food being cold, both our dishes tasted fine(my wife's salmon was a bit undercooked so she did not finish it.) I asked for the check, and went to the bathroom to wash my hands... A kitchen employee uses the urinal and rinses his hands WITHOUT USING SOAP.  That is a big problem to me.  I go to tell the manager and he just laughs it off.  I'm sorry but I don't find it funny that an employee that prepares food has just touched his penis and hasn't washed his hands. I get the change back from the check and its $20 short.  Apparently people don't wash their hands or count change correctly here.  Thank god we ate BEFORE Edward Penis-hands used the toilet. Go on an off-peak time.  They are just sloppy Friday and Saturday nights.

I've been to this place a handful of times and today 's was the worst experience I ever had.   We came in around 12 noon and the place was pretty quiet.  We were seated in a comfy booth facing the most amazing view of Gerritsen Beach.  The water, the boats, the homes, the swan...  Just breathtaking. The person taking our order was cordial enough, but the problem started when we received our orders.  Something was missing from the 3 out of 4 orders...  Food the was mediocre at best today.   And I thought the service could have been better. The fact that the view was so beautiful prevented me from giving this place 2 stars.  I think today was just an off day.

Went here after a late movie with family. We were hungry and TGI was right across the street so why not.  We got there and saw people waiting outside so you know its going to be a busy night with a long wait. Went inside, left our name and waited to be called.  I have never seen such poor service at a restaurant. (I'm assuming) they were short staffed that night so the manager had to bust tables. The waiters were slow, the floors were wet, the hostess looked and acted like it was her first night working there, two workers were actually sitting at the tables eating and talking.  Workers arguing at the front of the restaurant while customers watched. One customer actually went to the hostess asking for the check because they were waiting so long for their waiter to pass their table. We finally got seated and realized that half the restaurant was empty. As in they had people waiting out front with more than enough tables available to accommodate them.  The food we waited so long for was subpar. The mac and cheese looked microwaved, the burger dry and the fries were cold when it arrived. The portions were so small and disappointing we had to add mozzarella sticks to our order.  Not a fan of Fridays but I rather go home hungry than return to this one. I would suggest to order from the bar and stick to finger foods, you avoid the long wait for tables and food.

My boyfriend took me here tonight for our 3 yr anniversary. We wanted to go to Applebees but it was packed and didn't feel like waiting, oops should have went to ab, the wait here was horrendous. We did get seated in about 10 min, but the drinks took about 20 min, apps maybe a half an hr and entree at least an hr, could never find our server, I got the chicken cobb salad, it was ok, but no dressing, I finally tracked down our server who said she would get some, got it finally after another 20 min. our apps were mozarella sticks and the plate had marinara sauce splattered on it. My bf got a burger and fries, the fries were barely existent, I asked the server if it was possible for him to get more fries, she then proceeded to roll her eyes at me, needless to say we found this place super slow, crappy food and bad attitudes from staff, won't be back!!

Party of 3 had dinner at this Friday's after watching a movie nearby.  The host told us to sit and wait for a table despite the clearly empty tables all around and 10 minutes later we had to ask another host to sit us. Then the waitress taking our order looked bored and kept forgetting parts of our order. Food wasn't terrible but it wasn't good either.  Party of 3, we paid $120 with tip, for that much I want to go to a place where the workers care.

What has happened to this place of business? Before sandy hit they were the place I went to when I wanted fried foods and drinks. Now the business is terrible. Went there when they first reopened last year and the service wasn't that bad. So I decided to come again this year and I've been there 3 times now and each other worse than the last. The wait for a table is about the same it was before sandy. When they finally seat you it takes a good 30 mins for someone to come over and take your order. The drinks take another 20 mins to come and one time I was there me and my friends waited a good 45 mins to get our food. It was cold by the time it for to us. I'm usually not a complainer but this location of Friday's needs to work on their management and how they work around the bar and kitchen. Is it just this location that's terrible? Because for the love of all that is good on this earth Friday's has good food but this location is giving it a bad name. Please do something!
20 min to be seated on a Monday and the place is empty.. Server took another 10 min to take our order. Now waiting for appetizer for 25 min...they have very bad management...

Come here all the time and the service used to be really good. But as of recently, the service is so awful. I sat there for 20 minutes and literally no waiter came up to me to take my order nor greet me no matter how many times i asked for one. Got up and left.

Where do I even begin....WORST SERVICE EVER. I wanted a simple night out with my sisters and we ended up being there for 2.5 hours and ordered only 3 different types of food. I got the endless BBQ flat bread, my sister got the fried shrimp and the other got French onion soup. All this took 1 hour to make!! Server had no sense of humor nor any sense of decency to ask or recommend anything. This server was outside telling a story to a customer who was her friend and then has the audacity to tell me to wait.  Then when I ask for the check it didn't come for 30 mins. When I came up to the kitchen I saw her on her phone talking to her friends and she says she forgot to bring it out.  Total and utter mistake coming here. If I could give this zero stars I would. Refund would be nice...

If I could give you no  stars I would. Please health department shut this place down. It had the biggest roach I have ever seen on Saturday night. The waiter slapped my hand away when I was trying to take a picture of it. The manager comes out and just moves our seat. Then there were another insect crawling on the floor. The service then sucked even more when we got our food 2 hours later... after being seated. The waiter barely came to the table, we had to keep signaling or waving like retards so he could bring us something. Worst service I have ever had. But of course we would received an erroneous bill at the end. smmfh what a waste of space.

Service was decent. Food here is mediocre, appetizers were good though. Steak was expensive, way too dry and not tender, it made my boyfriend lose his appetite. He had to get his order fixed because they overcooked his steak, and again it was still dry, he ended up not even eating his steak. I got the shrimp entree with mashed potatoes, it was decent but too salty.

We came here for a birthday dinner and received horrible service! The wait staff was nice but that was the only positive thing I can say about this review. Simple drinks such as Sprite that were ordered when we first sat down came out after the food was served. They were no napkins u too were were wrapping up our plates to go home as leftovers. And lastly, an entire entree came out as we were also wrapping up the leftovers. I do not see myself coming here out of will again. And this was not a busy time of day at all.
This place sucks. Service keeps getting worse.  Never again! One star is being too generous.

Came for dinnner before movie across the strreet.  Good thing I made a reservation because there was a long line.  Nice restaurant.  Food is ok, atmosphere is good.  Mixed crowd but a lot of young people.  Service and wait staff was great.  Floor was a little sticky where we sat but I think that may have been from a recent spill.  Very relaxing looking out at the water.  Outdoor seating was available but we sat inside.  I had the cobb salad with steak and the rest of my party had bacon cheese burgers.  Burgers were good but the cobb salad was average.  Appetizers were excellent and they kept them coming as advertised. Been here before.  Not disappointed.

We were a party of four and the restaurant was pretty quiet for a Sunday afternoon.  We ordered two Berry Mojitos that were quite tart and tasted nothing like a mojito.  We then ordered the loaded nachos, which had about two tablespoons of cheese, and undercooked bacon, which we sent back. I ordered the grilled salmon with rice and spinach.  The salmon was good and tasty, the spinach had no flavor and the rice was definitely left over from Saturday.  Two people ordered the onion soup and stated that they threw a piece of processed cheese over the top, and called it French onion soup.  After we received our main course, the server brings back the loaded nachos, bacon was cooked, but there still was only about two tablespoons of cheese on it.  We didn't eat it.  They served sweet potato fries cold, so my wife returned it, they came back double fried and over cooked, she returned it again.  I wanted to speak with the manager on duty, but he looked very unprofessional, and un groomed, so I figured discussing all of the food issues would not be addressed accordingly, so we paid the bill and left.  This is not the first time we have had problems here, but everyone has bad days, well TGIF in Brooklyn, you have run out of chances.  We will never eat at this establishment again, nor will our friends, and hopefully their friends as well.

I usually don't come to this Friday but they have since done the place over after hurricane Sandy. Let me just say I'll never come here again. They take no pride in their service and food what so ever. I ordered a non alcoholic juice with pineapple, guava and something else it was on the menu. It came out with a moldy pineapple on the glass. I immediately sent it back for a sprite. My son's food was cold , my sizzling chicken and shrimp came out hardly sizzling and shrimp colder than everything else on the plate, the shrimp also had a foul taste. (I have ordered this dish at other Friday's) I went to the rest room and there was noo  tissue GREAT! Save your money and time at this sheepsheads bay location. Stay away!!!!!!!!!!
Messed up part of my order, took longer than expected to prepare the food.  The salt/sodium content is insane.  The burger did not taste great, nothing special.

To say that the service was slow AF would be an understatement.  Our table of 4 ORDERED 3 Endless Apps and 1 Chicken Fingers kids meal.  The apps came in 10 minutes the kids meal took over 35! We were on our second round before my son got his meal.  He was the only one that got a refill on his drink but THAT took over 20 minutes!  I could understand if it was crowded but it wasn't.  This was such a disappointment.

The service was not great at all but the food was alright.  We were seated and waited for 15 minutes while a waitress clearly saw us sitting and waiting but did not bother to come up to us at all.  We had to yell out excuse me when she was walking around and even then our orders took a really long time and mind you this was a Monday!! I understand the kitchen could have been overwhelmed but it wasn't so busy and the waitress could have at least given us our drinks. But no, she was too busy with other tables..  It wasn't that busy and tables that were seated after us received their food and attention from their waitress/waiters before us.  We complained to the manager who made sure to take care of everything. He finally got us water after 20 min of asking our waitress. He was really great!  The food was okay.  I would come here again only because this location is nice and we did have a good experience here before!

I have been to numerous TGIF locations and this one takes the cake of being the worse! I first walk in with my wife and we were seated quickly in the middle of the restaurant floor. My wife felt uncomfortable and asked for an different table. She was first brushed off by the hostess, which is unacceptable. The waitress then approached us about 20 min later and again my wife asked for an different table. She then called over the hostess and the hostess found an booth in the corner. We proceeded there and was asked for our drink requests. An hour passed by and we haven't received utensils, napkins, plates and not even a glass of water. We order appetizers and we again received it cold and without anything. We still haven't received our drinks,  which three different people came to verify the order and still nothing. We requested the manager and explained the issue and the waitress came over with an attitude and yelled an smart rude remark and ran off.. which was unacceptable. The manager did nothing to reprimand her, so we walked out! I will never go this location of Friday's ever again! And I will recommend that go at you own risk.

Waitress forgot about our table. Non busy sunday 2pm. Seated right away place was 1/2 empty. I had my hyper 3 y/o with me so I did not complain when I was seated in a desolate corner below the main floor. Waitress took order and brought drinks and one appetizer with 30 mins (no plates though). Never saw the waitress again. 1 hour and 20 minutes after being seated our food was served ice cold. Not luke warm but ice cold. The food was sitting in the kitchen so long the melted cheese was already hard and stale. Instead of apologizing or even asking about our food the waitress just sent her manager. Mind you we were very pleasant about the horrible service.  The only good part about the whole meal was the manager Greg.  He apologized profusely, got us new food in 10 mins and comped the whole entire meal after seeing the inedible food. He even comped the "cup of dirt" desert we ordered after the fact cause we promised our 3 y/o for behaving so long. All in all we walked out at 4pm. The waitress could care less. Never once checked in on us, never offred a refill and shrugged when the terrible food was served. This place needs more Greg's. Its a shame cause there are not too many kid friendly options around.  Every visit has been worse and worse this will be my last.

I WISH I CAN GIVE 0  ,,, This place is so fucked up I been coming here for a long time even before the Renovations after sandy ,,, tonight I came in after a movie hungry with my girl ,,, remind you the restaurant was empty expect for a couple tables on July 4th at 10pm ,, the too host in front said it'll be a 30 min wait looking around confused  I see only maybe 3-4 table occupied in the restaurant so what ever we went to the bar to get food ,, this nice waiter toke out order at 1021 the only  one with smile and warm welcoming ,, long story short we order a chicken salad and some appetizers ,,, appetizers came quick BUT THE FUCKING SALAD TOOK HALF AN HOUR TO COME! AND GUESS WHAT? A salad doesn't take 30 min to make!! And when we asked the waiter where our food is, she went and asked for the manager. 10 min later we get angry waiting for the "manager" it's been around 40 min with out our SALAD! We told our waiter we don't want the food anymore, and we are walking out. Then one of the employees who already changed and clocked out came   Because he heard us talk to the waiter, and had the nerves to tell our waiter that "what they food is made for no reason"??? WE WERE SHOCKED. Like are you kidding m?!? This place is soooo messed up with its customer service! And the food time! In conclusion, the manager never showed up, we payed for our two cokes and walked out. This was the worst and I repeat THE WORST RESTAURANT I HAVE EVER BEEN TOO! Avoid at all costs.

Service is horrific. Food kept coming out cold. Even once I mentioned that I was not happy nothing seemed to improve.  First of all it took one of 4 bar tenders 10 minutes to ask us what drinks we wanted. Took another 5 minutes to poor one beer.  It then took 30 mins for apps which came out cold. The French dip had no Au Jus and the bread tasted a few days old.  I watched two other customers send food back whilst I was there. Don't waste your time

I decided to pop in for a late lunch on Friday...BIG MISTAKE. Let's go down the list of everything that went wrong. 1) cold appetizers 2) no drinks until after we  received our entre but people seated after us were served their drinks. 3) found a piece of plastic wrapper in my pasta. The manager did offer to remove my pasta from the bill and replace my dish but even that came back horrible. Only ok thing about this place was my waitress was nice.

Beautiful location over looking the bay. TGI Fridays is reminiscent of an upscale restaurant from the decor to the layout. Definitely one of the better looking Fridays that I've been to.  However, with all of that being said it doesn't matter because the service is absolutely atrocious. It took 20 minutes for a menu to come my way. That's because I had to call a waitress over. Staff members passed by my table 10 times and I wasn't acknowledged.  Of course I didn't just sit there helplessly. I've tried calling whoever passed by over but to no avail. I guess they couldn't tend to me because I wasn't apart of their section.  I enjoyed the sizzling chicken and shrimp with a substitute of mac & cheese instead of mashed potatoes. I also had their house Long Island special. My entree was delicious and my LIT was good but then it became watered down 3/4's of the drink. I won't be back. I don't have the patience to wait.
Nice place, best view to Canal, good food but..... They keep the music SO LOUD you can't even hear nothing across the table!

The worst ever. Poor management and systems.  We waited forever just to get our drinks.  When we finally got our drinks and appetizers they still haven't brought us any utensils.  I ordered two kids pasta dishes and one of my son's pasta marinara looked like old chili on dry pasta.  I ordered the chicken and shrimp jack Daniel's with sweet potato fries. My chicken was drier than a desert and my shrimp was super over fried.  They gave me like 9 fries that were cold.  My sister ordered the Cajun pasta and that was overcooked to death and cold.  They switched it for a ribeye steak and ask for medium rare and got super dry well done.  I waited forever to get the check but they did comp us two out of the three meals.  This is probably the worst service I have ever experienced. They need better management. Don't go there.

Picked up our order placed online which was quick. I ordered a vegan Beyond Meat burger without the cheese and Fridays sauce with super veggies side. The burger was very good, but it was burnt on each side which distracted the amazing taste of the burger itself. My sister ordered a vegetarian Beyond Meat cheeseburger, but they forgot to put the Fridays sauce and gave her fries as a side instead of mashed potatoes (the fries are not vegan/vegetarian). Overall, the meatless burgers were OK but burnt. They were not worth $14.49 each, especially with the lack of vegan-friendly sides.

This place is so mismanaged. Was seated at 8pm, ordered our food and endless pot stickers. The apps came a little slow, but ok. We finished the pot stickers, and ordered another round of pot stickers. My entree took a while longer and came cold, still no pot stickers, waiter said he put in the order for the pot stickers.  Finished my entree, still no pot stickers. Waiter came, cleared my plate and said kitchen is backed up. It's 9:30, still no pot stickers. It's 9:40, pot stickers came, 2 orders! I'm going to roll n roaster's next time.

I haven't been here since pre-hurricane Sandy and I must say that the renovations were a total upgrade. It feels more spacious. If the waitress seats you around the window area, the view of the bay is really cool. And you become convinced of wanting to try some water activities after seeing people canoeing/kayaking. The decor speaks English/Irish pub style with lots of wood (tables and bar), leather (I think it's real) booths and of course, they have a few specialty beers. Not a beer connoisseur so I can't tell you what they had. My date was pregnant; I didn't want my homegirl to feel anyway so I skipped out on ordering alcoholic beverages. We both ordered turkey burgers along with mozzerella sticks for appetizer. For drinks, I ordered a virgin mudslide and she got lemonade. Honestly, the mudslide did not bring a smile on my face. It was missing an ingredient. I shrugged and kept drinking, though. I don't really like to send anything back unless it's horrific. I decided to keep it.  My girlfriend enjoyed her turkey burger but I didn't. It tasted weird to me. I took one bite and I was done. The three mozzerella sticks that I ate was enough to fufill me until I got home so I can eat it again. Service was cool. We had a very nice waitress.  TGIF is right in front of the movie theater so it's very convenient to get a quick bite and have some drinks. Don't expect meals to be five star rating but it serves the purpose. And can I add that Girl's trip movie was lit? It's definitely worth a second viewing.

The service is terrible. We waited almost 20 minutes with no waiter, not even a glass of water. I approach the greeter at door and requested manager that took 5 minutes. Into almost 30 minutes later manager approach and stated "shift change of staff & someone will be over shortly! 5 more minutes pass and we put on our coats to have last word to manager. We were told to  wait patiently again at table by assistant manager. We departed and went to Applebee' s a few blocks down. We were greeted, waiter offer water and drink selection within 5 minutes or less. We order our food within 10 minutes. Now that's service. Unfortunately I give this FRIDAY'S 1 star rating, because this isn't the 1st time of bad service.

Asked how long the wait was and they answered 20 minutes(there were about 15-20 people in the waiting area(not together apparently)). But saw the bar was half empty so I opted for that. Once I sat down I noticed that there were about 6 tables empty but figured it was a staffing issue(strike one).  Only 2 employees behind the bar with about 12 people seated. Found a menu that was laying by and chose a drink, funny enough there were no prices on the menu for cocktails(strike 2, Fridays where the big ballers go who dont need price tags lol). Took a while to get the attention to put order in(about 5 with a few "be with you in a second"). When the employee came(server: 778 ryan according to receipt) I was told that my choice from the "Here's To Livin' Light" menu was only for online/take out orders(It doesnt say that on that menu, will add picture of menu later). Took our drink orders and came back a little on the long side of 5 minutes again(with a few "be with you in a second"). Drinks were good but was starting to get a little light headed from drinking on an empty stomachs for 15 minutes. I normally dont like to bother people and be "that guy" that complains to the waiter but after ANOTHER 15 minutes I decided to stare a hole into the waiter. I guess it worked cuz he nodded a table waitress over to me and she came over and all of us knew something was off about the food not being here yet. She came up to us and said she'll check up on the food(she could probably tell the look on our faces of "wtf?") Strike 3. After some yelling in some other language from the bartender to the kitchen area it was something about not having that side and to choose another. My friend ended up blaring out just put anything on the plate so we can eat already. We got our food and it tasted good but then again after 45 minutes from sitting down and watching other people eat their food and leave I'm guessing anything might taste good. BTW they mixed up the sides (that were available to us), I got one of hers and she got none of the sides she wanted but we just shared plates at that point(just insult on top of the injury lol)
Really poor experience, order was incorrect, missing orders, drink was incorrect. We were ignored, and were excited to leave and never return.

Lipstick on my glass of passion fruit tea and I did not wear lipstick. I was disgusted by receiving a dirty cup. I already felt apprehensive by "Grade Pending" health grade. The staff was ok but cleanliness can't be subpar to make the visit worthwhile. They were apologetic. My waitress took a while to make it to the table but when she was present her service was fine. My waitress substituted my broccoli for zucchini without my consent. I don't eat zucchini. I use to hang out here when I was younger for the dj and drinks. Thank God for evolution, for now I will pass.

Every visit the customer service and rating continues to decline. I am not sure what's happening with the management and employee service here but it is certainly horrible. I went here on a Friday afternoon in the middle of the day at 2:30pm. There was no rush nor was the restaurant crowded...and were seated around 2:45pm even though the place was empty. The reasoning for this was because a female manager came out and said she has to give her workers and kitchen staff time to catch up so she'll seat us in about 15 mins. I am not sure of her name but her role in this dining experience gets better. While waiting in the entrance to be seated... she's telling the hostess that she doesn't know what's going with the kitchen staff and that another waitress can't even handle the tables she has now, so don't seat anyone. This is unprofessional and ill-mannered. The whole conversation was just uncomfortable to make any customer leave or go home. I didn't leave because my guests and I were hungry and we knew the food here wouldn't disappoint. We were wrong... we eye say shortly after. The same female "morning manager" as she called herself told us "To be honest with you you put in your order now and I don't know when your food is going to come out I have no idea what they're doing back there but I suggest you put something in quick". Right away my guests and I asked her her role here she said she's a Morning manager and she would go see what's going on in the back (the kitchen). She had no work ethic whatsoever. Our server came about 15 mins after (please remember there is no rush in this place whatsoever) she takes our drinks order and our endless apps order. Fifteen minutes later my order for apps comes out and my guests are still waiting. No drinks came out not even glasses of water were offered. We didn't see our server to complain about waiting so long for our drinks and other apps to come out. She came when we first Ordered our apps and then I asked her for water. She brought out the water about 10 minutes later saying the bar was making our drinks.... whenever we looked over at the bar she was with a couple socializing and tending to Their every need whilst a table Next to mines and ours waited on her. The drinks that "the bar was making" came Out about 20 minutes later. We complained about our apps not being refilled or the the first round not coming out. Finally the two missing orders of apps came out we had to call over our server to place our entree orders. She took the order and whisked away again to be at the bar with friends still a table Next to mine was trying to get her attention. Our food came out after 4:00pm and please note the time we came in. I have never had such a horrible dining experience in my life. I didn't like that she kept lying to us about a burger not being cooked yet and the chicken not being ready. Her excuses were just used To excuse her horrible service. The friends she had at the bar, came in after we did and left before we did. I will never come back to this Fridays again. Ever. Absolutely disgusting the customer service is horrible the attitude of the workers are unprofessional and the management is just as bad. This location has changed for the worse over the years and now I see why people continue to rate it the way it is.
Ordering food here is like waiting in the DMV line. If your planning to watch a movie you should come 2 hours ahead time.

This place is HORRIBLE I've been here a few times and its always the same bull shit however today is seems worse, the place is almost empty and I'm wondering where is my food its been over 40 minutes.  Last time, I'm done, we are not coming here again and my ass is still sitting here as I'm writing this review.   Update: Manager came over, he was very apologetic, nice man.   I think his staff is to nonchalant.  Very nice location however this needs to be corrected.

If you know Brooklyn well then you know the beauty of Sheepshead Bay. It's by the water and is up and coming. So any business lucky enough to be in this area will benefit from the large crowds that flock here to enjoy the view. So if I was running a world famous franchise such as "TGI Friday's" in this area, it would be the best, well run business in the area, right? Well the only positive I can give them is the view, other then that let me explain why. I came here for the first time with my Girlfriend and her three friends. They like coming here because of that view I mentioned before. Once we walked in we waited to be seated. But the wait was longer then our dining experience there. A hour into our wait we asked the hostess or waiter, whoever it was because he didn't say, what was the hold up. He replied they don't have the staff to accommodate all the guest. I thought this was interesting because it would have made sense and it could be possible if the place was packed. It wasn't. It was empty and there were seats available. You mean to tell me, we couldn't be seated and offered drinks until a waiter could come serve us? The guest behind us told us to pay attention because they were seating people before us that came later. I wanted to say it was because of the size of our party but again they had plenty of available seats. This place wasn't being managed at all. The guest that spoke to us finally decided enough is enough and left. We waited this long we wanted to see this thing to the bitter end. After about a hour and a half we were seated. The waiter took our order and we waited for the food. At this point I was starving, so I knew it wasn't going to be pretty once the food came. I have eaten at "TGI Friday's" before, but I must say I was so disappointed. I'm not going to go into a lengthy discussion on the food except to describe want I noticed. I can't really explain the taste of the food, so let me tell you how it looked.  This was the first time my food looked sad. It looked as if it was mistreated before they cooked it and it wasn't proud to be a burger. I couldn't even believe they sent it out like that to me with three strips of tiny bacon and some skimpy french fries. This was not what I expected from "TGI Friday's". This part of Brooklyn should be a priority for the company because it's so busy. If this place was run correctly it could be a recommended tourist attraction. But unfortunately it's not a place I will visit again. I just walked away thinking to myself why didn't we just go to "Checkers?"

My boyfriend and i was planning to watch a movie, the movie hasn't start yet and we were starving! So we decided to grab some food here since its across the street. This place is always pack from day time to midnight. We were in a rush so we sat at the bar, we waited for 10 minutes and no one gave us a menu or pay any attention to us. I finally got a bartender attention and order us some cocktails while we look at the menu.   I literally wave my hand and try to get his attention many times, finally we get to order food after 20 minutes. Our buffalo wings, burgers, and steak came. But guess what, he didn't give us any utensils. The best thing here is the bacon cheese burger, the wings and steak i would not recommend it. We tried ordering more drinks, but we gave up trying to get someone attention. Bad service.

This is probably the worst TGIF I've ever been to. Their kitchen is smaller then an average bathroom hense why the wait for your food takes about an hour to come to your table on even a slow day. The salad we ordered which was a strawberry field (mixed greens with feta and strawberrys was basically watery lettuce with old feta and strawberrys and basamic. Come on we all know arugula is a much better choice to put instead of lettuce. The manager's excuse was because of the hurricane's they can't have anything else delivered to them. Poor excuses for a new York restaurant. This place needs new management and a bigger kitchen so your food can come out faster.

Everything takes forever. Ask for water: wait 20 minuets. Ask for your check: wait 20 minuets. The place is big & inviting but mostly empty so it baffles the mind why food, drinks & the check take so long. And when you have children waiting isn't ideal.
Well after coming here for several years, this is the last time. The folks who work here are rude, and the food has gone downhill. I will have to try someplace else for my after movie hangout.

I had a steak with the jack Daniels glaze. Ahhhmazing! From the second we walked in the service was phenomenal. Great views. Nice open space. The tables aren't squished together.  Drinks are on point. I got recommend the mai tai! I have allergies and the bartenders have great suggestions to make the drinks really good.  Endless appetizers.  Great environment for friends. Prices are good for what you get as well.

If I could give no stars I would.   So first I am greeted by a nasty young lady and told I have to wait 15 mins.  Ok no problem, even though there are empty tables every where.   Moving on. Order drinks as soon as we sat down, our drinks came after our disgusting  appetizers, my husband drinks (rum and Coke) was flat.  My sons chicken fingers must have been cooked in the same oil they cooked something garlicky  I will NEVER come here again. Applebees is right down the road.   Oh and I forgot to mention how dirty the place was.   I would be embarrassed if I owned or managed this place!   What a shame

Don't waste your time,  I'm sure you can find a better option in the area. Went here on a Saturday evening with a group of 5. We weren't seated for over an hour in a restaurant that was not that busy and I could see many open tables.  Their reasoning... they didn't have a server for that area. How do you have too few of servers on a Saturday? Isn't that the busiest night for all restaurants in America?  We did notice a lot of groups of 2 and 4 being seated; some that came after us. Their other reason, they only had square tables for 4. Solution: get more round tables that can accommodate odd numbered groups if needed.  I will say our server was pleasant... when we saw her. Since we got squeezed in a random corner we weren't attended to often. It even took 35 minutes to settle the check [1 credit card] I took advantage of their unlimited appetizer special ($10) and topped it off with 2 watered down house Long island iced teas. The other entrees ordered at the table looked very delicious, so food wise, we were satisfied.  I regretted agreeing to travel to the ends of the earth (deepest corner of Brooklyn) from the moment we waited more than 30 minutes for our table. And at no time did this restaurant change my mind.

This place is awful. I asked why there was a C health rating and the hostess had no idea and refused to answer the question. Waited over 45 minutes for five meals. Waitress was inattentive and brought waters out 30 min after we sat down. I got a Caesar salad because i was disgusted by the rating which sucked. DONT COME HERE  My friends said the Mac and cheese burger was good but i would be afraid to get food poising

Please, close down and leave the neighborhood. I've been going to this tgif location for about 17 years, when they still had the separated sports bar where you can smoke. It used to be delicious and great service all around. After storm sandy hit and they renovated, it's been pure garbage. I've been here 5 times in the past 3 years, walked out twice. Service is just as bad as the food. The last straw was Game 5 past week, cleveland vs golden state, they were at 20% capacity, how am I going to sit at a bar and wait 15 mins for a drink, while the bartenders are chilling around. 4 girls walk in and get attention right away from one of the bartenders, they have turned this place into their own playground. Food has been nasty since they re-opened.  Save your money, go to many of the other business's in the neighborhood.

Very disappointing. Worst TGI Fridays I have ever been to.  I was excited to hear they were back opened but the service and the cold, uncooked food proved otherwise.  I am sure they will still be profitable because they are right by the theatre but if you are reading this review beforehand, trust me when I say your money is better spent somewhere else.

While waiting for some friends to arrive, one friend and I sat at the bar and ordered drinks.  The place was not crowded. Very rainy night.  Thirty five minutes later, the server brought out one drink, and it was partially empty and my drink never showed up.  She kept saying they were making it (nothing fancy).  We gave up and I cancelled.  When the rest of the party showed up, they tried to put us in a booth made for 4, but there were 6 of us.  We had to wait for a table.  We waited 30 minutes for someone to take drink orders. We only ordered soft drinks and tea since the bar (3 bar tenders) was too slow. We finally got a server who was very good and the evening got better. We were very generous with gratuities.  After, I tried to get my car from Valet Parking, in the pouring rain, but there were no attendants (at 9PM).  Turns out he was sleeping in a car and never saw me trying to find him and I was soaked. Someone from the restaurant came out and was flashing lights at him to get his attention. He had left my car open door and my front seat was flooded.  Made no attempt to help and didn't bother to bring the car where I was waiting in front of the restaurant.  He put his hand out for a tip and I had to ride home sitting in a puddle on my leather seats. Managers were very aware of what had transpired.

As with many of the other reviewers, we stopped here after a movie for apps and dessert.   The wings and potstickers were very tasty and well prepared.  The dessert was yummy (brownie thing with ice cream etc). It was just right.   In addition I had a different experience with the service than many of the other reviewers.   I had absolutely no problem...our server was attentive, quick, and available when we needed her.   For sure I'll be back!

Customer service is horrible. Super Short on staff , we were seated for 30 minutes and even our appetizers came before we received forks, napkins and utensils. Do not come here for a pleasant meal, very Unsatisfying service and food takes forever to come. Waiter will also check up with you once every 30 minutes so the next time you come here, Bring a pillow and blanket.

Tonight's wait was insane. Waited about 40 min for a table for 4. Weird thing is....... It wasn't crowed. The game was about to end and they just weren't sitting ppl.
