After we say we waited another 10-15 min for the order to be taken....... A manager had to grab a bartender to take out order. Although the Food was great tonight, I was highly upset with tonight's service!

My experience at TGIF tonight was much better tonight than a couple of weeks back when I went.  I went with three other people and we were seated promptly. We ordered a round of drinks and our appetizers. We got the three for all (boneless wings, potato skins, and pot stickers.) The pot stickers really weren't good at all, I believe they were suppose to come with some kind of sauce to dip them in, but we didn't get any. The boneless wings and potato skins were good. For my entree I got the sizzling sirloin over spinach, zucchini, and mushrooms with a side of tomato and mozzarella salad. It was good, a little spicy, which I didn't like and was not indicated on the menu.

This place needs to get it together. I write this review as it goes on 25 minutes waiting for a order of boneless chicken. I ask my waiter about my order and she just says "the kitchen is backed up right now" no apology, nothing. As if I'm suppose to know this. We sat at the bar and the bus boy kept bringing us the wrong orders. The food is mediocre, service is horrible. The only good thing about this place is the head bartender who is working his ass off and is funny as hell, that's what gave them the extra star. This place is the epitome of a brooklyn venue. I always try to give my borough a chance but experiences like this makes me just want to stick to the city.  Ohh; Finally got my wings at the end of this review 35 mins later. Save the trip here until they get it together. After my edit: my chicken was raw in the middle. Check your food before you dig in. Seriously

Probably the worst service I've ever had at a restaurant. I've been trying to think of a time I had worse , but just can't... Whoever is running this place needs to be fired and get a new manager.  Really terrible.........

Horrible. Order was wrong, service was poor and food was bad. Called in an order of two salads, two sides and a kids meal. When I arrived 25 minutes later to pick up, the order was never picked up so I had to wait at the bar for another 20 minutes. Instead of two sides and a kids meal, I got two kids meals and one side. The salad had huge lettuce stems in it. The part at the bottom of the lettuce head that you would never eat. My salad had two of them in it. Would never go back.

As a very frequent customer . I have never really had a problem before . Today I was not to pleased with the hostess . She dragged her feet around and moped all the way to sit us to a small table , yet when we asked to switch us to a bigger table she said that none were available when only a few feet away there were a few . Then talked to a waitress right in front of us and when the waitress told her that she sat us in a section where there is no waitresses she pointed to the bartender and said she had told him that he had a table when he had no idea . I've been a hostess before  at least smile . If you don't like your job , try to at least pretend to , or leave .

This place is in desperate need of new management. They don't know what's organization. They make people wait long time even though there's empty tables all over. Then, after placing your order, takes forever for the food to be out. Food wise, it's ok but some are loaded with extra salt. Waiters, some are very nice, some not. Anyway! I'm in food business and this place needs new management very soon. If they still have business it's because of the movie theater.

Worst service I've experienced. They mistakenly gave our table to someone else and then to make up for it, gave us a small table. We got only 2 menus for 5 people and. Our waitress seemed very rude even after all the things that went wrong. 0 stars.

So I was happy to know they were opened again after being destroyed by Hurricane Sandy. However, my first visit back and I wasn't too please!!  I like they have valet parking, the staff is friendly, clean location and it's bright with a modern look!! My chicken pasta and spinach dip was nicely hot and tasty when it came to the table!  I dislike the slow service, my salad was drenched with salad dressing which takes away from trying have a salad! My dessert was missing its walnuts because they ran out!!! I ordered the dessert mainly for the walnuts and I was very disappointed they ran out!! I've learned my lesson now to ask for my salad dressing on the side and I will add it myself and ask if the kitchen has all ingredients to make my dessert before ordering!!  Also I find it to be smaller in size but the bar looks amazing and being able to look in the kitchen is cool! It takes away of wounding what's happening to your food!

I've tried to like this location. The service at the bar just doesn't exist. Had the ribs, dry and tough. It's such a nice place, too bad they can't find a good management team. It all starts at the top.

I do not want to give this place any star! This place deserves poop ratings!  It is Thursday night after the movies, so it is easy to go right across the street and grab dinner. Thursday nights they have a DJ,which makes it a happening place.  But for an almost empty dining area, they sure do take a long time to get you seated. We waited about 13 minutes to be seated. After getting seated, looked at the menu and waited for another 15 minutes. There was no waitstaff that came by to acknowledge us! I mean if that person acknowledge us and told us, they'll be right back, there'd be no problem. But NONE! Everyone was too busy walking back and forth and cleaning up empty tables.  This is not the first time this has happened to us. I always like to give the restaurant & management the benefit of the doubt. But this is the last straw. I cannot come back here until they change their ways of customer service!

This was an unsatisfactory experience at TGIFriday's. My cousin and I arrived and were told there was going to be a 20-25 minute wait.. That was to be expected at Friday's, so we waited. While we waited, 2 couples strolled in past us and went straight for the bar. The hostess said nothing to them. She didn't even ask if we wanted to sit at the bar or not. Where we were sitting as we waited were 3 empty booths. Also,we saw a group of 7, 5, and 2 leave and we were still told that we had to wait. Another employee came and started talking to the hostess.. She stood there with the hostess for at least 15 minutes.. Could she have been helping the others clean tables for the mounting number of guests coming through the door? I guess not..     Finally after a 35 min wait, we were seated. Our waitress was nice and she apologized for our wait. When we asked her what was going on, she said there were only 4 waiters/waitresses and ONE BUSBOY! I was shocked when she said that.. Granted it was a Monday night but still..  That's ridiculous. She said that the staff kept getting double and triple shifts, so I guess they decided to go on strike or something..  We told the waitress we were starving and she brought us some chips and cold salsa. I didn't mind the salsa being cold because she didn't have to do that. My drink was tasty and my food was good. The waitress was pleasant, so she made up for everything else.     Safe to say, I won't be patronizing that Friday's for a while...

Been here a few times, great views, great friendly service, decent drinks, food is just what it is standard chain diner fare, only negative is depending on when you go you get harassed by parking attendants to valet park your car

I'm giving this place one star because there's no way to give 0 Stars I haven't been to Friday's for almost a year now and this reaffirms why I stopped going there service was horrible they don't know what is going on there I asked for a beer I didn't like it didn't drink it they said no problem we'll get you a different one I ordered a blue moon they said the blue moon is out after 30 minutes that they went to change it and it's not working and the waitress said is does anybody want this beer that nobody drink you sure because I'm going to throw it out no charge then she still charges for the beer I got my food before I ever got any drink how is it you have to wait an hour and a half to get a beer at the bar really recommend going somewhere else will stop going there again for at least a year we'll see if things change in a year

If there was a 0 star this place would get it. Staff was lazy and tables uncleared.  The food quality went down after Sandy renovation.  The wings were dry and burgers were over cooked. I have given this place 4 tries cause I thought it might've been a bad night when I came before. But now my fourth try and we are done.  The place used to be our favorite. But they got lazy because they know they're the only Fridays in town. Luckily I can go to a better one which is forest hills.  Will Not return here unless dragged by my heels.   P.S: The owner should hire a new manage; someone that actually cares about customer service. John Taffer would be pissed if he ever came here.

I should've read the reviews before coming here. The servers are friendly, but the service is inconsistent. The cups, plates, and utensils are all dirty. There is a very strange off-putting smell lingering. The apps were cold and super greasy - I mean like squeeze-out dripping greasy.  The sizzling chicken entree came sizzling hot but the sides were wilted and not worth the money spent. I will not come back. I recommend that you only come here if you want overpriced drinks in dirty glasses, because the view is nice...

This is a "C" food restaurant.   My sisters, daughters and myself stopped by Monday for lunch.  The waitress Jessica was patient and nice.    However, the cook time fie thr food was vety slow.  It seemed like it took close to an hour for thr food to come.  What made it especially bad is it was lunchtime on a Monday with only 5 tables filled.  Both of my  daughters ordered the ribs which looked dry and tough and were.  We noticed that some of the utensils were not as clean and they should be.  What made it worst is that they were given a letter C by the Health and Mental Hygiene department and have it hidden behind the hostess booth inside of the restaurant.   This is supposed to be display for patrons to see prior to entering the establishment.   DISGRACEFUL AND DISGUSTING.

I like TGIF, but not so much this location.  The service sucks and my food was served with an attitude.  I gave their margarita a try and it came extremely watered down. Not to mention that half of the frozen drink was already water.  Our drinks took forever (almost half an hour), no wonder it was melted by the time it came.   I do enjoy the artichoke and spinach dip, this location gave us pita bread instead of the regular  nachos and it was great. Also I love their brownie bowl, it is so good it really stands for itself.  This location just wouldn't be my pick for Friday's.

I love Fridays,  but this one is the worst. I've given them 3 different sites at getting it right and always something goes wrong.  I'm not picky, but I should get my meal in a reasonable time when it's durum g the week and empty.  Management needs to step up their game.  I will not be returning to this location,  I rather go to Applebee's in Sheepshead Bay.

I went there last week with my husband and the best thing about that day was the fact that we got water when we were seated. Not sure what happened to this place in the last few months but my complaints are: 1 - Spinach was not cooked (AT ALL); what they attempted to cook had large gooey stems on it (GROSS); most of the other food was cold and steak was a bit tough. 2 - Wrong order was placed and I paid extra for the wrong type of food? Come on....not cool. 3 - Overworked staff. They have the waitress bussing tables and sweeping and collecting orders and taking food to the tables. - TGI Fridays - I see a serious labor issue there. Get it together. I hope they can get it together. Its a nice atmosphere when its cleaned up and has nice staff working there (not all of them are people friendly). They need a new way to get the attention of birthday folks too....scared the life out of me yelling like they did.

Came here to grab a bite after the movies. The restaurant was half empty and we got seated right away; and that is where the service stopped. Sat for 20 minutes without being approached even once by anyone. There was a table right next to us whose waitress kept checking in but did not not even bother to look in our direction. Several other waitresses walked by and didn't even acknowledge our presence. As we were walking out the hostess who sat us 20 min ago made eye contact and walked away. Needless to say we will not be coming back!  Went to Applebee's got seated and had our drink order taken in 5 minutes. Now that's what I call service! Friday's can really use a lesson in costumer and food service!  * Only reason I am giving it one star is because Yelp won't let me post a review without any.

Where is Giuseppe?! I love him (my boo understands) and the last two visits we didn't see him. He's a real waiter, he understands needs and basic service and he delivers so much more. Tonight was the grandbabys 5 th birthday celebration. We didn't have to wait long, but the hostess sucks. I stood there for 5 mins before she acknowledged me (she wasn't doing shit) and then...I started this review last year and didn't finish. Well this TGIF needs a real MANAGER. Apparently Thursday night is dj night?! 8pm with my 13 year old on his birthday and we have to SHOUT across the table. NOPE NUH UH. Only thing it was his choice so I suffered through it. I'd been 2x in between reviews but fuck it. Go to a REAL restaurant. It's simply not worth it. And yes the kindergarten staff has gotta go! This used to be the go to Friday's. Sadly, not anymore. BTW, my servers have always been good.

Came here on a Monday night 8pm. Restaurant was half empty but they still had us sit and wait for a table. Decided to eat at the bar because we had to catch a movie and figured it'd be quicker. Food was good and the server that took care of us was great. She was nice and rushed our order because she knew we had a movie to catch. Why the 2 stars? The rest of the staff at the bar was lazy. We tried to get their attention to pay the bill (because our original server was busy actually working) but one guy was too busy turning up the volumn on the tv and the others were standing around chit chatting. The best part? There's valet parking now (for what? No one knows) and those guys stole our quarters! Who does that?! It's rough outside to earn a buck but seriously? Quarters? Not planning to come here ever again.  If you do, give yourself enough time (we had an hour and 15 mins to get in and get out) and park somewhere else or take your quarters with you!

I don't ever give bad reviews or 1 star ratings but my experience was terrible. I entered the restaurant with my girlfriend and niece at around 5pm. The hostess was nice and told us there would be a 5 minute wait which wasn't bad. As soon as we sat down there was a woman trying to sell us gift cards which was weird because they are the 10$ gift cards which you receive when you spend 50$ or more.) she asked us if we were planning to spend more than 50$ on our meal and we replied no. She gave us a rude look and walked away. Another hostess then sat us in at a table near a window where it was freezing cold and there was no heat. We didn't want to eat with our coats on in the uncomfortable temperature so we kindly asked to be moved with made the hostess a little irritated. She then moved us to a booth where we proceeded to wait 15-20 minutes without anyone coming to our table. There were waiters and waitresses assisting tables around us and tables that were seated after us. We saw servers talking amongst themselves and not giving us the time of day. We didn't even have someone bring us water, or introduce themselves. We kindly left and told the manager. We will never return. We were treated unfairly because we refused to buy gift cards and didn't want to sit by a cold window. I do not recommend this restaurant! You are better off visiting the Applebee's 5 minutes away!

The place had better days. And today it is mostly nostalgia that bring me here. They have a OK food, and OK service, and as long as you know that this is what you are about to get, and avoid high expectations, you will have good time here. For me it is simple, and have been for a long time: Sirloin and salad. I know how it is going to taste like, and I know I am about to eat it all. The staff here was nice and relaxed, and our waiter was very attentive to us (As well as to other tables). Refreshing location, I think others should follow.

When it comes to atmosphere this Friday's is hands down the best . Over looking the pier having a few drinks with friends. Plenty of televisions scattered around with smooth up beat music playing over the sounds of laughter .. Visit this spot all the time just for the ambiance.. Well recommended oh yea $3 Martinis

Let's get this straight from the get-go, you come here for the food. Not the greatest food, but the food you saw on a commercial last night and said, "Gosh darn it, that looks scrumdiliumcious."  Now, it's TGI Fridays in the boondocks of Brooklyn, and the food is, well, edible. To be quite honest, I'm unsure of why I keep coming here. Perhaps it's because of those persuasive endless appetizers and their Jack Daniels everything, but that's probably about it.  Their service? Well, no one stands at the host(ess) stand, so you're pretty much in famished limbo until the TGI Dude(tte) finally delivers you to what seems to be your savory salvation. Finally, you get to sit down, do the whole "what should I get? Oh, that looks good!" bit, and then you wait for your sever. And wait. And wait. Wait some more. Call over the manager. Wait some more. Oh, look, there they are! Finally they take down your order, give you an attitude, and try to (horrendously) up-sell you.  If you want water, you need to call the manager over so they can tell your server to do their job.  If you want your bill, you might as well take that 20-minute catnap while you wait.  In general, if you want anything, well, good luck with that. I hate tipping poorly, but man, they are just that bad.  If yelp enabled me, I'd give them a -4 (+1 star for their generic chain food).

I really hate taking a star off since I am not hard to please, but I think there are some issues that need to be addressed with this place. I understand that this chain is not luxurious or top of the line, but it shouldn't be a terrible experience either.  To make the long story short, I literally had to wait to wait... the line to get on the list with the hostess took forever. She also told me I would get a text to my phone when the table would be ready, they got rid of the buzzers, and to be honest I never got a message. I ended up missing my table call twice because it was that disorganized. When I was finally seated, the waitress chardonnay decided it wasn't necessary to give us utensils to eat our food. How do you bring me plates with no fork or knife first? I also did not like how the waitress kept rushing me to do my next refill for the endless apps, I felt pressured which makes no sense for this deal. She also did not bring us lemons for our waters in time, we were done with our drinks by the time she brought it, that's how long she took. I also don't appreciate her bringing us the check when we didn't even ask for it. Let me start by saying I am not a fan of the TGIF chain. This location is on the water and they leverage the view with an outside deck.  The interior is much nicer than every other TGIF I have visited the past three decades. You'd probably be as surprised as me when you walk inside. There is adequate staffing and every person we encountered was efficient, cheerful, and helpful.  In fact, they are collectively the best staff I have ever encountered at any TGIF (any restaurant?).  The manager of this place should be proud of the staff that's been assembled. This leaves the food.  Well, it's TGIF so it is adequate.  It's the same food as every other TGIF.  That said:  it's time for the chain to improve their gluten-free options.  My daughter has Celiac Disease, so we dine gluten-free, and TGIF is lagging way behind the competition in providing alternatives.  We were presented with menus and a separate "menu" listing all the allergens.  So, it's a noble effort, if cumbersome, but the upshot is that there are very few GF options. This location is by far the best TGIF I have ever visited, and my family will visit more often when the menu improves.

Going to TGIF was the worst experience of my life, I arrived to the restaurant with my girlfriend and we had to wait for 15 minutes. As much as I used to hate this place, I have to say they're doing a lot to make it a better place to eat.  Before Sandy it was disgusting in here. Fruit flies and gnats everywhere, the food was nasty and it was just not good at every turn.  Fast forward to 2016. Their menu has many more options, the service is much better and they are out to make the customer happy. For instance, on two separate occasions I came in and ordered something that I really didn't like. Not their fault, it just wasn't my thing. Both times, they took the dish off my bill without me saying a word about it. That's great customer service.  I give three stars mainly because for one, they advertise on their menu having my favorite beer and they actually don't have it. And two because the bruschetta chicken pasta which used to be so so good made with angel hair pasta and just a hint of sauce is now made with fettuccine pasta and slathered in so much sauce it can't be enjoyed at all because it's all you taste, instead of a nice blend of the chicken, pasta and sauce. Also, the spinach dip has gotta go. Or at least change the cheeses. The mixture of those two particular cheeses just doesn't work. I thoroughly enjoyed the jack Daniels sampler platter and the miso wings though, so I'm glad that's one of their signature "things". All in all, I would probably come back for happy hour to eat some apps and have a few beers at the bar but not really for a meal.

This place is horrible. They do a horrible job trying to cover up their microwave food. Everything tastes bitter/burnt. I ask for medium steak they gave me a black burnt piece of doo doo. I would recommend mcdonalds over the this asylum.

I decided to give this specific location a try about 4 times before I wrote this review. Yes I still decided to give this place a try although I saw that it had extremely poor ratings across, Yelp, Google and its counterparts for reviews - I know, I know, only a loon would do that, right? Well I am a little nuts....about Brooklyn anyway! So because I didn't want to lose hope in my native borough and not believe the saying that all good food & entertainment is across the water in Manhattan.      The first time I went with my Fiance and son. I didn't feel like cooking so I thought it would be a great chance to go there for dinner. This was about 8-ish. We had a waitress that was very friendly, helpful and quick with pushing food out of the kitchen. She made sure our cups stayed full and she suggested drinks and appetizers when we were a little indecisive. This was before the endless apps craze so we wanted something shareable and we were not disappointed with the potato skins. We were so happy with her service we gave a generous tip and vowed to return.     The second visit was with my fiance only and it was a spot we chose to try again for lunch. We figured that since it was a Thursday afternoon and we both were free until our son's dismissal at school it was a great opportunity to see how lunch service was. We arrived about 12-ish and was seated immediately because it was a ghost town in there, aside from a few elderly members who probably seeped out from the neighboring retirement complex a block over for some afternoon coffee or soup and one or two fathers out with their little girls for a daddy & daughter lunch which I thought to be too adorable. At this time the endless apps had started and our waitress told us about what our choices were so we settled on two apps and some sort of rum concoction cause we figured 12pm equals 5pm somewhere. Anyway the food came out quick but the drinks took forever to come witch I don't understand when the bar population including the bartender was 2. We had a birds eye view of the bar and it was empty! We asked about our drink and the space cadet said "Oh I didnt bring your drink? I know it was made. OOOhh there it goes *points at bar* I left it over there. I knew I had them. I'll make you fresh ones"....smh She got $1 tip from us. No way should we have sat down in the 12th hour and not leave after 3. Despite that we returned cause We didnt want to count this place out because of one dingle berry.  Since that visit^^^^^^^ management has changed, they've hired a slew of new people and service had in fact improved. Ive gone a lot of times since the afternoon disaster including the time where management tried to end the endless app which we complained to the new manager about and he apologized and removed a few bucks to sooth our unhappiness cause in fact thats what we drove down there for - the apps special! The last time I have been here was two weeks ago and I observe how well then staff works together, service is better than ever, food always come from the kitchen hot, Im not seeing revolving wait staff like the first few times so I hope thats indication management is much better this time around. I do recommend this place. I dont understand the poor ratings. I have had only good service here except that afternoon ding bat. Otherwise its been good. I give it 5 stars. Super friendly staff, just treat them like people, not the help. Maybe they will respond to you better you 3 star givers and rememer this is TGI fridays not chateau Leraunt or whatever foo foo service you expect - they sell bufalo wings not caviar!

Came here before my movie around 12pm on a Saturday.  We weren't seated immediately because the person was seating someone else, so we waited like 5 minutes?  The place looks so different from before, it's nice.  We sat by the giant windows where we could see the water and the boats.  The booth was very small, but fits 2 people.  As soon as we sat down, the waitress told us some of the specials super quick and jetted off.  We had some time to look at the menu and then she came back to take our order.  The appetizers came super quick and hot, so that's good.  The entrees came almost right after we finished our appetizers so that was good too.  We didn't have contact with the waitress except when taking our order and getting the bill.  There aren't too many waiters and waitresses so that might be why service is poor but I saw them training a bunch of new workers.  I think I got lucky during this visit because there weren't too many people at the restaurant, maybe because I was early.  Overall, it was ok - just like any other Friday's.  The food is good, so it always has me coming back.

I came here on a Tuesday night. It was pretty crowded, and there was about a 20 minute wait for a table. However, there were a lot of empty tables. We were brought to a table and not given any silverware just the menus. We sat there for 20 minutes and no one came over. The waiters went to every other table around us and never came over to us. We got up and left and went somewhere else.

Service the worst. I am still waiting on my food. Took over a hr and food never came out. They cause me to miss my movie. And a manager never came out and address the situation. I will never return back to this location.

If there's any chain restaurant I enjoy, it's this one. TGIF serves up some dishes that are a lot tastier than their competitors in my opinion (i.e. Applebee's, Chili's, etc). This location reopened recently after being closed for over a year due to Hurricane Sandy and I just tried it out the other day. Unlike most other users' reviews, I thought the service was great (most likely because I came during lunch hours when the crowd wasn't nearly as busy as dinnertime). The food, however, was very MEH. Not as yummy as it used to be. I ordered an appetizer of the fried green beans with a wasabi sauce, and while the green beans were good, it tasted like they were sitting out for awhile. The breading was soggy and overall disappointing. For my main course I ordered the chicken fingers which were tasty, but dry. I had to drench them in the honey mustard to make them more tolerable. The side of fries weren't great either, as they were overcooked. I'll come back to this place again, I'm sure, but the other TGIF locations serve up much better food than this one. The three stars goes to the new-and-improved atmosphere and the impressive service, not the food.

Went here last night with my fiancé and daughter and the wait time was 20 minutes. That wasn't bad considering we didn't wait that long anyway. We were seated and it took a while to be served because the waitress we had seemed to be running around like a chicken with her head cut off. We finally ordered and our food took a while to come as well. When it did, the portions were average. I ordered the French dip. It was good but too small and there wasn't much fries that came with it. I wasn't satisfied so I went to order desert and the only desert they had was called the Tennessee Whiskey Cake. I didn't want it so we asked for the check instead. She mixed up our receipts with someone else's. It was just too much going on. The only good things I can say about this place is that the food was good, its a nice setting and they offer free WiFi. Other than that, don't waste your time or money going here

There is absolutely no reason to have a bathroom attendant at a TGI Fridays in Brooklyn. I wouldn't recommend getting any pastas here unless you are used to the quality.  The waiting area is very narrow and can get annoying when it's very busy and you have an hour wait with so many people crammed together. Just had a disappointing dinner. Pecan crusted chicken came out stone cold. Sent back. Three minutes later it was back, steaming.  It did not taste anything like fresh food. I won't be back anytime soon.

Best TGIF in Brooklyn.... Convenient location right across from the movie theatre. Have drinks while you wait for your movie or just on a date . The bartenders are extremely friendly and entertaining with there bottle tricks. The food is also good.

I love Fridays and I have been to several different locations, but the one here at sheepshead is the worst one ever.  Not even in terms of food but of service.  Every time I come here in it takes a good 15-30mins from when I sit down before someone comes over to ask for my order.  All the while I watch 2-3 waiters/waitresses walk by without even acknowledging my existing.  I'm not sure if they are freakin racist here as I see other people getting serviced and I am the only Asian person in here or just whether they are just that damn retarded.  If you must have Friday's, head to the one in Green Acres Mall, it's a drive but your food and waiter will show up way faster!!!
Since the reopen , it's looks grown up now , and not some teenager hot spot , good tasting food , but the waiters take some damn long to get to the table !!!!
The service sucked, waiters took forever. Waited over an hour for our food and it was not even worth the wait. Never going back ever again. Don't recommend.

Great atmosphere and great service. Our waitress Energy had positive energy throughout service. The food was served in great order, meaning appetizers did not rush out the same time as the entrées. The drinks where made to perfections as if it came out of the menu book. I don't know why a lot of people have sour-ass reviews but sometimes it's always good to see for yourself.

Went there on a Sunday night after the movies.  The place was full but not packed. I saw a lots of empty tables but still we had to wait for 45mins for a table. Minus one star there. So after 45mins finally we got our table. But we sat no one came for a good 10mins or so and no busboy or waiter gave us any water.  Ok..so finally the waiter came though he's very courteous.  After we finished with our apps no one came and pick up all these empty plates to make room for our entrees we had to call on a busboy  to pick them up for us. Anyway, the whole story short the food was good but the service was very slow.  Still dont understand why.  It wasn't that busy.  I see all these waiters and waitresses running around in the dining room for no reason. Hummm..

Much better experience this time. Orders were correct and Ivy was pleasant as well as the manager on duty . Stayed for about an hour with my family and had nice seating near the window. The cajun fettuccini is so good, maybe better than Rasta pasta.

I'll keep this short and simple. Came here yesterday with my girl, sat by the bar. The bar had 4 or 5 bartenders working. One bartender told us she will help us once she cleans off our area. Waited another 20 minutes hoping one of the 5 bartenders will finally serve us some drinks, wishful thinking I guess. We were completely ignored without anyone bothering to even ask us anything or even LOOK at us. No menus...no drinks...shit service. It's like we were invisible. Not surprised they only have 2 stars. Absolutely disgusting bathroom with piss all over the floor, clogged toilets AND urinals, towels everywhere except for the dispenser. I'm really surprised this place doesn't have a listing yet, considering how popular it is. But oh well. *makes one* :) For out-of-towners and Brooklynites who don't know the area, this particular Fridays is located right by the popular United Artists theater across the street on Harkness Avenue. There isn't much else in that vicinity aside from Red Lobster, a Cold Stone Creamery, and the docks. (And several sleazy hourly-hotels on the Emmons Avenue strip, but we don't talk about those.) Anyway, back to Fridays. THE FOOD Honestly? It's the same menu everywhere, so it's pretty much just like any other Fridays, with top notch, delicious dishes and great mixed drinks.  THE SERVICE Oh Fridays, how I wish you would get your act together when it comes to your "servers". This is the main (and maybe only) reason I don't give this place 5 stars. I would, but the table service is atrocious (and yes, it's bad enough to knock it down 2 stars). Even on a quiet night, nobody seems to know their heads from their asses as far as who's handling what table, and about 5 different people end up coming by to introduce themselves as "your server for the evening." The best part though? After any of them actually introduces his/herself as a server, they just DISAPPEAR for the rest of the night, never to be seen again, except maybe from a distance, blabbing to a coworker about something unimportant. Almost every time I've been there (and that number is quite high), we've literally had to flag down three people to ask when someone will actually come to take our order.  Once we FINALLY lasso a "server", there's more waiting for the food. This is the reason for the second star down, because I've been exponentially frustrated at seeing dozens of people get seated AFTER me and served before my food even came out - even if they ordered the same dish I did! There doesn't seem to be a concept of fairness or service order in that place, despite the "servers" being so grossly obsequious when you actually do flag one down. (And as a side note, they also seem to come by to incessantly bother you at the worst moments, like if you're sitting there sobbing to your boyfriend, or you're in the middle of a screaming match on the phone with someone (just examples I've witnessed), they'll be like, "Would you like anything else? ^________^" and just stand there over you. Great courtesy, guys.) It takes forever to get the check too, so make sure you give yourself ample time if you're eating dinner before a movie. Otherwise the check will make you late. Because of the theater, on big movie nights the volume patrons is VERY high. On opening weekends and summertime Friday/Saturday nights, it's almost impossible to get seats. You'd end up waiting an hour or more if you don't have a prior reservation, (which is almost as bad as Midtown Manhattan restaurant wait times). Even WITH a reservation, I highly doubt you'd get any faster service with such a disorganized staff. Despite the crappy service, I'd still go back time and again. Their Jack Daniels Flat Iron Steak is just too good to miss.

I happen to really like TGIF. And now that they're doing promotion with the $12.99 for three course meal, I keep going back. The food is yummy, although I wouldn't order steak here. I like the sizzling chicken and shrimp and the appetizers are okay too. They aren't too bad with seating parties of 2, usually a 10 minute wait maximum for me. And it's so convenient that it's right across from the movie theater. Movie and then dinner, sounds like a date. (:

Starting with apps we choose the combo with crispy green bean fries, potato skins with cheese and bacon, and buffalo chicken wings. Small plate but surprisingly filling already. Should feed about 3-4 people max. Moving onto entrees I ordered the Jack Daniel Combo and that's were we ran into trouble but later to be mentioned. In the combo I choose the chicken and 6oz sirloin which will fill you up if you had the apps and this together. Now other people on my table ordered the 2 for $16/$12 combo where you choose an app and entree. Your choices are limited but it will still fill you. But now to the cons. Sadly to say on the day that I went (5/5) they had to 86 all ribs on the menu due to a party that morning that sold out the ribs. I was looking forward to it but until next time. Another con is that it took forever to be seated though they try to squish 7 people into a 5 people booth which I think it wasn't smart and we waited for another table to be opened. ALWAYS CALL AHEAD OF TIME BEFOFE GOING THERE TO RESERVE SEATS!  Lastly shoutouts to the terrific staff that made our meal enjoyable. First with the seating, they asked if we liked it first and when we didn't they would go look for another one. Secondly throughout the whole  meal not only out server asked how it was going; others like manager and other servers asked as well. Which I think it was something I haven't seen in many restaurants.  Though this is still a new restaurant; things may change and the review may not be accurate as the opening past. But hope it will stay with all the pros and fix the cons! So try it out won't be a waste of your money!
